{"step_by_step_thinking": "Eugenol is a component of zinc oxide eugenol cement, which is used in dentistry. It is responsible for the sedative and analgesic properties of the cement. However, it can be replaced by other substances that can provide similar properties. Acetic acid and phosphoric acid are not suitable replacements because they are too corrosive and can cause tissue damage. Alginic acid is not a suitable replacement because it does not have the same properties as eugenol. Ortho-ethoxybenzoic acid, on the other hand, is a suitable replacement because it has similar properties to eugenol and can provide the same benefits.", "answer_choice": "D. Ortho-ethoxy acid"}
